info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 5 at 8:50PM PDT until September 7 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Pendleton OR
info.description:
...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS IN KITTAS VALLEY AND EAST- WASHINGTON SOUTH CENTRAL CASCADE MOUNTAINS TOMORROW...
.Isolated to scattered thunderstorms capable of producing abundant cloud-to-ground lightning are forecast Saturday beginning around 4 PM through 3 AM Sunday. Some storms will produce a wetting rain.
The National Weather Service in Pendleton has issued a Red Flag Warning for abundant lightning, which is in effect from 4 PM Saturday to 3 AM PDT Sunday.
* AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 690 Kittitas Valley and 695 East Washington South Central Cascade Mountains.
* TIMING...From 4 PM Saturday to 3 AM PDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Any fire that develops will catch and spread quickly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
* THUNDERSTORMS...Isolated to scattered thunderstorms capable of producing abundant cloud-to-ground lightning and gusty outflow winds.
* OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusts up to 50 mph.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
